definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: The broader Standard &Poor's 500 (SPX) index finished just a fraction of a point above Thursday's close.
sentences.chinese: 標準普爾500指數僅僅比周四的收盤價上揚一小點。

sentences.english: Stochastics track the positioning of daily closing prices within the daily range.
sentences.chinese: 該指數的主要研究對象爲日波動區間內的收盤價。

sentences.english: The shares are trading at about 21 times per-share earnings for the past 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 週二收盤價約爲該股過去12個月每股收益的21倍。

sentences.english: Share prices in the United States have closed at their highest level for eight months.
sentences.chinese: 美國股票收盤價格達到八個月來最高水平。

sentences.english: Calculate the difference between the target price and today's closing price.
sentences.chinese: 計算目標價位和當天收盤價的差異。

sentences.english: Closing prices are most often used to compute Bollinger Bands.
sentences.chinese: 收盤價是最常用的計算布林線。

sentences.english: Stocks markets have opened slightly higher, picking up from where they left off on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 股市略微開高，從上週五收盤價開始波動。

sentences.english: Updates with closing share price in the ninth paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 在第九段中更新了最新收盤價。

definition: sum (result of addition)/addition/total/to add up a number of items/to accumulate
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
